newsitem.title: USA: Barney's has not reviewed Dickson bid.
newsitem.headline: Barney's has not reviewed Dickson bid.

text.p: Luxury retailer Barney's Inc said Friday it had not yet reviewed with its advisers a takeover offer from Dickson Concepts (International) Ltd of Hong Kong.

Barney's, which filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection last year, said Dickson's proposal was "to invest in the company as part of Barney's recapitalization" under a company-sponsored plan of reorganization.
Dickson, an upmarket retailer, offered current Barney's ownbers $240 million cash and a minority stake in Barney's non-U.S. store licensing income.
Barney's said it has had "numerous discussions" with Dickson and its various representatives regarding elements of a potential investment proposal.
It said it did not receive Dickson's formal takeover proposal until early this morning and has not had a chance to review the offer with its financial and legal advisers.
Barney's said it had anticipated the Dickson proposal as part of the Hong Kong company's completion of a "due diligence" review of the Barney's books and records.
Barney's said it has been involved in talks with potential investors as part of its efforts to develop a reorganization plan that maximizes its value.
Barney's emphasized that it retains the exclusive right to file or advance such a plan.
